contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> Image:trencheswwi2.jpg|World War I begins image:Walk fig1.jpg|Examples of pathological conditions present in the Kennewick skeleton File:JStalin Secretary general CCCP 1942.jpg|Joseph Stalin Image:Alberto Fujimori.jpg|Alberto Fujimori File:Ian Thorpe with a smile.jpg|Ian Thorpe </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1809]] – [[Peninsular War]]: French forces under [[Joseph Bonaparte]] suffered 7,270 casualties while [[Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington|Sir Arthur Wellesley]]'s Anglo-Spanish army had 6,700 at '''[[Battle of Talavera|an inconclusive battle]]''' in [[Talavera de la Reina|Talavera]], Spain. | needs more footnotes |- | [[1896]] – [[Miami]], today the principal city and the center of the [[South Florida metropolitan area]], the seventh largest metro area in the United States, '''[[History of Miami|was incorporated]]''' with a population of just over 300. | refimprove |- | [[1973]] – About 600,000 people attended what was '''[[Summer Jam at Watkins Glen|the largest musical concert in history]]''' at the [[Watkins Glen International|Watkins Glen International Raceway]] near [[Watkins Glen, New York]]. | refimprove |- | [[1990]] – '''[[Alberto Fujimori]]''' took office as [[List of Presidents of Peru|President]] of [[Peru]], becoming the first person of Japanese descent to be the [[head of government]] of a Latin American nation. | {{tl|confusing}} |- |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1914]] – [[Austria-Hungary]] declared war after rejecting [[Serbia]]'s conditional acceptance of only part of the [[July Crisis|July Ultimatum]] following the [[assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand]] in [[Sarajevo]], starting '''[[World War I|World War I]]'''. {{*mp}} [[1995]] – Two followers of [[Osho (Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh)|Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh]] were convicted for the '''[[1985 Rajneeshee assassination plot|attempted assassination]]''' of the [[United States Attorney]] for the [[United States District Court for the District of Oregon|District of Oregon]]. {{*mp}} [[2001]] – At the [[2001 World Aquatics Championships|World Aquatics Championships]] in [[Fukuoka]], Japan, Australian '''[[Ian Thorpe]]''' became the first swimmer to win six gold medals at a single World Championships. {{*mp}} [[2005]] – The '''[[Provisional Irish Republican Army]]''' announced an end to [[Provisional Irish Republican Army campaign 1969–1997|its armed campaign]] to overthrow British rule in [[Northern Ireland]] to create a [[United Ireland]]. {{*mp}} [[2010]] – In the [[List of accidents and disasters by death toll#Aviation|deadliest air accident]] in Pakistan's history, '''[[Airblue Flight 202]]''' crashed into the [[Margalla Hills]] north of [[Islamabad]], killing all 152 aboard. ==Notes== {{*mp}} [[July Crisis]] featured on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/July 23|July 23]] so WWI should not appear in the same year. {{*mp}} [[Provisional Irish Republican Army campaign 1969–1997]] featured on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/July 19|July 19]] so IRA should not appear in the same year. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[July 28]]''': '''[[World Hepatitis Day]]'''; [[List of national independence days|Independence Day]] in '''[[Peru]]''' ([[1821]]); '''[[Parents' Day]]''' in the United States (2013) <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em;"> [[File:Bonus army on Capitol lawn cph.3a00515.jpg|Members of the "Bonus Army" in front of the US Capitol building|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1540]] – King [[Henry VIII of England]] had his chief minister '''[[Thomas Cromwell]]''' executed for [[treason]] and [[heresy]]. {{*mp}} [[1932]] – [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Herbert Hoover]] ordered the eviction of the "'''[[Bonus Army]]'''"—a group of veterans who were occupying government property ''(pictured)'' to demand immediate payment for money owed. {{*mp}} [[1935]] – The '''[[Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress]]''' [[heavy bomber]] aircraft, which dropped more bombs than any other U.S. aircraft in [[World War II]], made its first flight. {{*mp}} [[1976]] – '''[[1976 Tangshan earthquake|An earthquake]]''' measuring at least 8.2 on the [[Richter magnitude scale]], one of the deadliest in history, flattened [[Tangshan]], China, killing at least 240,000 people. {{*mp}} [[1996]] – The remains of the prehistoric '''[[Kennewick Man]]''' were discovered on a bank of the [[Columbia River]] near [[Kennewick, Washington]], US. </li> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=July|Day=28}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
